thread.title: Instagrammer transforms London landmarks so they appear to float away
thread.title_full: Instagrammer transforms London landmarks so they appear to float away

title: Instagrammer transforms London landmarks so they appear to float away
text:
Instagrammer transforms London landmarks so they appear to float away 
This series of striking images will blow you away Saturday 18 February 2017 07:30 GMT Click to follow 2/8 Umbrella in the Wind www.avibphotography.co.uk 8/8 Millienium Bridge www.avibphotography.co.uk 
An Instagrammer has gained a cult following for his ethereal photographs of London landmarks that appear to be floating away, as though scattering like delicate flower petals in a calm summer breeze. 
Photographer Avi, who posts under the handle @avibphotography , has become known for his unique style of photography that involves editing London destinations and cheery scenes so that it looks as though they are blowing colourfully in the wind. 
London-based Avi says he started experimenting with the series “to create something new and different from the norm.” 
Speaking to the Evening Standard, he said: “When I first started, it would take me almost an hour and forty minutes [to edit each photo], but now I’ve got the process down the 15 minutes per image.” Philipp Ebeling's photographs are a love letter to urban London 
His photographs take in a wide range of the capital’s landmarks, from Big Ben and the London Eye to Tower Bridge and The Shard. 
Then there are quieter scenes of lovers kissing on the Southbank and vibrant umbrellas bursting their colours into the wind. Feb 14, 2017 at 12:21am PST 

Avi he says he manipulates his images using Photoshop, utilising several different brushes and effects to give the finished effect of scattering colours. The photographer says he taught himself the clever technique by watching YouTube videos. 
He now says he would like to create an exhibition of the images so they can be viewed in a gallery. 
Click through the gallery above to see Avi's work. 
Follow Liz Connor on Twitter @Lizconnor_ More about:
